Parameters: Path: the @B_android#graphics#Path_E@ to use to make the line representing the @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@
create(android.graphics.Path).Description: Create an @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ for an arbitrary @B_android#graphics#Path_E@. The @B_android#graphics#Path_E@ must begin at (0, 0) and end at (1, 1). The x-coordinate along the @B_android#graphics#Path_E@ is the input value and the output is the y coordinate of the line at that point. This means that the Path must conform to a function y = f(x). The @B_android#graphics#Path_E@ must not have gaps in the x direction and must not loop back on itself such that there can be two points sharing the same x coordinate.

Returns: the @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ representing the quadratic Bezier curve
Parameters: float: the x coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point
float: the y coordinate of the quadratic Bezier control point
create(float, float).Description: Create an @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ for a quadratic Bezier curve. The end points (0, 0) and (1, 1) are assumed.

Returns: the @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ representing the cubic Bezier curve
Parameters: float: the x coordinate of the first control point of the cubic Bezier
float: the y coordinate of the first control point of the cubic Bezier
float: the x coordinate of the second control point of the cubic Bezier
float: the y coordinate of the second control point of the cubic Bezier
create(float, float, float, float).Description: Create an @B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ for a cubic Bezier curve. The end points (0, 0) and (1, 1) are assumed.
create(float, float, float, float).FullName: Interpolator create (float controlX1, float controlY1, float controlX2, float controlY2)

ClassDesc: Helper for creating path-based https:##developer#android#com@B_android#view#animation#Interpolator_E@ instances. On API 21 or newer, the platform implementation will be used and on older platforms a compatible alternative implementation will be used.
